item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} - AdminStatus
item_prototype.description: ifAdminStatus OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX INTEGER { up(1), -- ready to pass packets down(2), testing(3) -- in some test mode } MAX-ACCESS read-write STATUS current DESCRIPTION "The desired state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. When a managed system initializes, all interfaces start with ifAdminStatus in the down(2) state. As a result of either explicit management action or per configuration information retained by the managed system, ifAdminStatus is then changed to either the up(1) or testing(3) states (or remains in the down(2) state)." ::= { ifEntry 7 }

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} - OperStatus
item_prototype.description: ifOperStatus OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX INTEGER { up(1), -- ready to pass packets down(2), testing(3), -- in some test mode unknown(4), -- status can not be determined -- for some reason. dormant(5), notPresent(6), -- some component is missing lowerLayerDown(7) -- down due to state of -- lower-layer interface(s) } MAX-ACCESS read-only STATUS current DESCRIPTION "The current operational state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2). If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic; it should change to dormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection); it should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state; it should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing (typically, hardware) components

trigger.name: Flow sessions (10% Available)
trigger.description:
>90% Reaching Device limits
Actions: Review traffic patterns Look for sessions with high inactivity timeouts Review Device type

trigger.name: Flow sessions (20% Available)
trigger.description:
80% -90 of Max PFE Sessions may be considered normal depending upon network traffic but requires investigation if increase is sudden
Actions: Review traffic patterns Look for sessions with high inactivity timeouts Review Device type

trigger.name: High CPU temperature on for node 1
node 0 high PFE CPU usage
trigger.description:
>95% Device responsiveness for transit traffic is likely to be impacted including session buildup
Actions: Review Traffic pattern Review PPS Review Session counts

trigger.name: node 0 high PFE memory usage
trigger.description:
>95% Transit traffic may be impacted due to inability for forwarding operations
Actions: Review system logs Verify configuration for unused features that be removed Disable non needed ALGs

trigger.name: node 0 high RE CPU usage
trigger.description:
>95% Device responsiveness for self traffic is likely to be impacted
Actions: Disable traceoptions Clean up storage Verify system processes

trigger.name: node 0 high RE memory usage
trigger.description:
>95% Device will begin active memory clean up attempts
Actions: Verify routing table size Verify System Processes in use Review system logs

trigger.name: node 1 high PFE CPU usage
trigger.description:
>95% Device responsiveness for transit traffic is likely to be impacted including session buildup
Actions: Review Traffic pattern Review PPS Review Session counts

trigger.name: node 1 high PFE memory usage
trigger.description:
>95% Transit traffic may be impacted due to inability for forwarding operations
Actions: Review system logs Verify configuration for unused features that be removed Disable non needed ALGs

trigger.name: node 1 high RE CPU usage
trigger.description:
>95% Device responsiveness for self traffic is likely to be impacted
Actions: Disable traceoptions Clean up storage Verify system processes

trigger.name: node 1 high RE memory usage
trigger.description:
>95% Device will begin active memory clean up attempts
Actions: Verify routing table size Verify System Processes in use Review system logs

trigger.name: no monitoring data
trigger.description: System does not provide snmp measurement data.

trigger.expression: {Custom - HW - Juniper SRX:icmpping.sum(#3)}=0 or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Custom - HW - Juniper SRX:icmpping.sum(#3)}<>3)
trigger.name: Ping check
trigger.description: The firewall device has stopped responding. This could indicate a failure and needs to be investigated.

trigger.name: System has been restarted
trigger.description: System hast been restarted. Confirm restart by manual close.
